item.title: Reviving Your MNEME: Predicting The Side Effects of LLM Unlearning and Fine-Tuning via Sparse Model Diffing
item.description: arXiv:2507.21084v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are frequently fine-tuned or unlearned to adapt to new tasks or eliminate undesirable behaviors. While existing evaluation methods assess performance after such interventions, there remains no general approach for detectin...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, arxiv, tool, fine-tuning, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: SynLang and Symbiotic Epistemology: A Manifesto for Conscious Human-AI Collaboration
item.description: arXiv:2507.21067v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current AI systems rely on opaque reasoning processes that hinder human oversight and collaborative potential. Conventional explainable AI approaches offer post-hoc justifications and often fail to establish genuine symbiotic collaboration. In this pa...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> embedding, framework, arxiv, reasoning, tool | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: The Geometry of Harmfulness in LLMs through Subconcept Probing
item.description: arXiv:2507.21141v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have intensified the need to understand and reliably curb their harmful behaviours. We introduce a multidimensional framework for probing and steering harmful content in model internals. For each of 55 d...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, arxiv, tool, model, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: NPO: Learning Alignment and Meta-Alignment through Structured Human Feedback
item.description: arXiv:2507.21131v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present NPO, an alignment-aware learning framework that operationalizes feedback-driven adaptation in human-in-the-loop decision systems.
